name.en: Offshore Wind Power and Multidimensional Environmental Parameters and Assessment
name.ch: 離岸風電與多維環境參數與評估

department.ch: 永續與綠能科技研究學院
department.en: Graduate College of Sustainability and Green Energy

goal.ch: 本課程旨在全面探討離岸風電產業中的多元議題，涵蓋從能源概論、專案認證、地質與地球物理調查到地震危害度分析，以及海氣象觀測與模式分析的各個層面，並探討環境影響評估與永續議題，同時以不同產業利害關係人的角度，如開發商、風機製造商、驗證方與環評顧問，探討風場開發的面面觀。課程核心重點包括：學生將學習並掌握台灣區域地質特性的關鍵知識，進一步理解這些特性如何影響離岸風電專案的設計和執行。其次，課程將探討地震危害度分析的基本概念及其實際應用，尤其針對離岸結構物的設計與安全性評估。此外，課程還將深入解析海氣象觀測技術與模式分析方法，確保風電場在各種氣候條件下的穩定運行。最後，課程將強調對離岸風電項目進行環境與社會永續影響的綜合評估，培養學生具備全方位的風場發展評估能力，為未來風電產業的永續發展貢獻專業知識與洞見。
goal.en:
This course offers an in-depth exploration of the offshore wind power industry, covering a wide range of topics including energy fundamentals, project certification, geological and geophysical surveys, seismic hazard analysis, and metocean observation and modeling. Participants will gain insights from various stakeholders, including developers, project certifiers, wind turbine OEMs (original equipment manufacturer), and engineering and EIA (environmental impact assessment) consultants.
A key focus will be on Taiwan‘s unique geological characteristics and their implications for the design and implementation of offshore wind power projects. The course will also cover essential concepts in seismic hazard analysis and their practical applications, particularly in the design and safety assessment of offshore structures.
Additionally, students will engage in a thorough examination of metocean observation techniques and modeling methods to ensure the reliable operation of wind farms across diverse weather conditions. Finally, the course will emphasize a holistic evaluation of the environmental and social sustainability impacts of offshore wind projects, equipping students with the skills necessary for comprehensive wind farm development assessments and contributing valuable insights for the sustainable advancement of the wind power industry.
